parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: To fill with power, strengthen, make strong. From en and dunamoo; to empower.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) To lead, (b) To think, be of opinion, suppose, consider.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Waiting at table; in a wider sense: service, ministration. From diakonos; attendance; figuratively aid, service.
